page.title: 03PAST AND PRESENT.
page.content: We interviewed some of the older inhabitants of the village who have lived in the area an average of some 50 years. In the last 50-60 years the village has changed very much.The old mill for instance has been disused for some years.The public house and several cottages behind the shop in the square have long since been knocked down.The village seems to have changed more on the outskirts than the centre. Wages have changed a great deal.In the 1910's pay was 32 shillings a week,but farm labour was 10 to 15 shillings.The farm labourers also received wood,coal and numerous other things free.In about 1910,the pension was 7 shillings a week.It later rose to 10 shillings.People began work at 14 years of age.
